item.title: Playing My Own Game
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1339" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Scatterbrained on Flickr"][/caption]

In reading The 80/20 Principle, I undertook some exercises recommended by the author to identify my 'happiness islands' and my 'achievement islands', times in my life when I was especially happy or productive. The pattern that emerged was that I have been especially productive when I'm either working for myself or have the freedom to set my own agenda and goals. My happiness is also strongly correlated with my independence.

item.title: How I Find Time to Write
item.description: I know that lately, I haven't been posting as regularly as Â I used to. I've felt the consequences. My readership has declined, and I feel like my writing style has gotten a little stiff from lack of flexing. Writing has always been a hugely important part of my life. Not only is it an artistic means to express myself, it has always been associated with periods of balance in my life; when I'm writing regularly, my mind and spirit are in order, and a lot of other things as well. When I can't find the time to write, things slowly come apart at the seams. I don't really know why this is. Perhaps writing is how I parse my jumbled thoughts into discrete, comprehensible units called words and sentences, which I can then manipulate and act on in my life. Without taking the time to do this, my thoughts and ideas just fill to the brim and overflow in a messy jumble of psychic disorder. Writing is a form of meditation, a kind of waking dreaming for me.
